story.hi: तीन मछलियाँ एक तालाब में रहती थीं, प्रत्येक की अलग-अलग स्वभाव था। पहली मछली सतर्क थी, दूसरी साहसी थी, और तीसरी मूर्ख थी। एक दिन, तालाब सूखने लगा, और समझदार मछली ने अन्य मछलियों को चेतावनी दी कि वे चले जाएं। साहसी मछली ने ठहरने और खोजने का फैसला किया, जबकि मूर्ख मछली ने चेतावनी को नजरअंदाज करते हुए बेवकूफी से तैरना जारी रखा। अंततः, तालाब पूरी तरह से सूख गया। सतर्क मछली ने एक नया तालाब पाया और बच गई, साहसी मछली एक मछुआरे के जाल में फंस गई, और मूर्ख मछली मरी गई क्योंकि बचने के लिए बहुत देर हो चुकी थी।

story.en: A merchant had a faithful donkey that carried his goods to the market every day. One day, the merchant decided to take a shortcut through a dense forest. As they were crossing, the donkey grew tired and refused to move. The merchant, frustrated, tried to push the donkey, but it wouldn’t budge. Just then, a clever fox appeared and offered to help. The fox convinced the merchant to let the donkey rest, and while the donkey rested, the fox quickly gathered some food for it. The merchant learned the value of kindness and never took shortcuts again.
story.hi: एक व्यापारी के पास एक वफादार गधा था जो हर दिन उसकी सामान को बाजार में ले जाता था। एक दिन, व्यापारी ने एक घने जंगल के रास्ते से गुजरने का फैसला किया। जैसे ही वे पार कर रहे थे, गधा थक गया और हिलने से इंकार कर दिया। व्यापारी, परेशान होकर, गधे को धक्का देने की कोशिश की, लेकिन गधा हिला नहीं। तभी, एक चालाक लोमड़ी आई और मदद की पेशकश की। लोमड़ी ने व्यापारी को गधे को आराम देने के लिए मनाया, और जब गधा आराम कर रहा था, तो लोमड़ी ने जल्दी से उसके लिए कुछ भोजन इकट्ठा कर लिया। व्यापारी ने दयालुता की मूल्य को सीखा और फिर कभी शॉर्टकट नहीं लिया।

title: The King and the Wise Man

story.en: Once, a king wanted to know who was the wisest man in his kingdom. He invited three renowned wise men to his court and gave them a challenge: to answer a question with a single word. The question was, 'What is the most important thing in life?' The first wise man answered 'Love,' the second said 'Wisdom,' and the third replied 'Kindness.' The king pondered their answers and concluded that all three qualities were important but realized that kindness encompassed both love and wisdom. He declared the third wise man as the wisest, valuing kindness above all.
story.hi: एक बार, एक राजा ने जानना चाहा कि उसके राज्य में सबसे बुद्धिमान व्यक्ति कौन है। उसने अपने दरबार में तीन प्रसिद्ध ज्ञानी पुरुषों को आमंत्रित किया और उन्हें एक चुनौती दी: एक शब्द में उत्तर देने के लिए। प्रश्न था, 'जीवन में सबसे महत्वपूर्ण बात क्या है?' पहले ज्ञानी ने 'प्रेम' कहा, दूसरे ने 'ज्ञान' कहा, और तीसरे ने 'दयालुता' कहा। राजा ने उनके उत्तरों पर विचार किया और निष्कर्ष निकाला कि तीनों गुण महत्वपूर्ण हैं लेकिन दयालुता ने प्रेम और ज्ञान दोनों को शामिल किया। उसने तीसरे ज्ञानी को सबसे बुद्धिमान घोषित किया, और दयालुता को सबसे ऊपर माना।

story.en: Once, Birbal was invited to a grand feast at the emperor's palace. During the feast, a guest claimed that he had seen Birbal wearing a diamond necklace. Birbal denied this, saying he had never owned such a necklace. The emperor, curious, asked Birbal to prove his innocence. Birbal cleverly suggested that the guest should look for the necklace in the palace. The search revealed that the guest had made a mistake. The emperor praised Birbal for his cleverness and honesty, reaffirming his trust in him.
story.hi: एक बार, बीरबल को सम्राट के महल में एक भव्य दावत में आमंत्रित किया गया। दावत के दौरान, एक मेहमान ने दावा किया कि उसने बीरबल को एक हीरा हार पहनते हुए देखा है। बीरबल ने इससे इनकार किया, कहते हुए कि उसने कभी ऐसा हार नहीं पहना। सम्राट, जिज्ञासु होकर, बीरबल से उसकी निर्दोषता साबित करने को कहा। बीरबल ने चालाकी से सुझाव दिया कि मेहमान को महल में हार की खोज करनी चाहिए। खोज में पता चला कि मेहमान ने गलती की थी। सम्राट ने बीरबल की बुद्धिमत्ता और ईमानदारी की सराहना की और उनके प्रति अपने विश्वास को फिर से पुष्टि की।

title: The Wise Elephant and the Monkey

story.en: In a grand forest, an elephant and a monkey were great friends. One day, they decided to compete in a contest to see who could gather the most fruits. The monkey, being quick and nimble, gathered fruits with ease, while the elephant used his strength to carry large amounts. At the end of the day, they compared their collections. The monkey had gathered a variety of fruits, but the elephant had collected more in quantity. The wise elephant then shared his fruits with the monkey, teaching him that sharing and kindness are more valuable than competition and quantity.
story.hi: एक भव्य जंगल में, एक हाथी और एक बंदर अच्छे दोस्त थे। एक दिन, उन्होंने प्रतियोगिता करने का फैसला किया कि कौन अधिक फल इकट्ठा कर सकता है। बंदर, जो तेज और फुर्तीला था, आसानी से फल इकट्ठा करता था, जबकि हाथी अपनी ताकत का उपयोग करके बड़ी मात्रा में फल ले आता था। दिन के अंत में, उन्होंने अपनी-अपनी फलों की संग्रहण की तुलना की। बंदर ने विभिन्न प्रकार के फल इकट्ठा किए थे, लेकिन हाथी ने अधिक मात्रा में इकट्ठा किया था। समझदार हाथी ने फिर अपने फल बंदर के साथ साझा किए, उसे सिखाते हुए कि साझा करना और दयालुता प्रतिस्पर्धा और मात्रा से अधिक मूल्यवान है।

story.en: One day, Emperor Akbar asked his wise advisor, Birbal, to answer three questions. The questions were: 'What is the most important thing in life?', 'What is the most valuable thing?', and 'What is the most difficult thing to do?' Birbal, using his wisdom, answered: 'The most important thing in life is to know oneself; the most valuable thing is the truth; and the most difficult thing to do is to keep one's promises.' Akbar was impressed by Birbal's answers and realized the depth of his wisdom.
story.hi: एक दिन, सम्राट अकबर ने अपने बुद्धिमान सलाहकार, बीरबल से तीन सवालों के जवाब देने को कहा। सवाल थे: 'जीवन में सबसे महत्वपूर्ण चीज क्या है?', 'सबसे मूल्यवान चीज क्या है?', और 'करना सबसे कठिन चीज क्या है?' बीरबल ने अपनी बुद्धिमत्ता का उपयोग करते हुए उत्तर दिया: 'जीवन में सबसे महत्वपूर्ण चीज खुद को जानना है; सबसे मूल्यवान चीज सच्चाई है; और सबसे कठिन चीज है अपने वादों को निभाना।' अकबर बीरबल के उत्तरों से प्रभावित हुए और उनकी बुद्धिमत्ता की गहराई को समझा।

story.en: In a small village in Italy, there lived an old woman named La Befana. Every year, on the night of January 5th, she would fly over the rooftops on her broomstick, delivering gifts to the children of the village. One year, a terrible storm swept through the village, and La Befana's broomstick was broken. Fearing that the children would wake up to find no gifts, she decided to walk from house to house, carrying her heavy bag. As she trudged through the snow, she came across a young boy who had no shoes and was shivering in the cold. Moved by his plight, La Befana took off her own warm shawl and wrapped it around the boy. She gave him the last of her gifts and continued on her way. The next morning, the villagers found La Befana asleep by the fire in the town square, her broomstick miraculously mended. The boy, who had been given the shawl, told everyone of her kindness. From that day on, La Befana's gifts were even more cherished, for they were given with a heart full of love.
story.it: In un piccolo villaggio in Italia, viveva una vecchia di nome La Befana. Ogni anno, la notte del 5 gennaio, volava sui tetti con la sua scopa, portando doni ai bambini del villaggio. Un anno, una terribile tempesta travolse il villaggio e la scopa di La Befana si ruppe. Temendo che i bambini si svegliassero senza trovare regali, decise di andare a piedi da casa a casa, portando il suo pesante sacco. Mentre avanzava nella neve, incontrò un ragazzino senza scarpe che tremava dal freddo. Commossa dalla sua situazione, La Befana si tolse la sua calda sciarpa e la avvolse intorno al ragazzo. Gli diede l'ultimo dei suoi regali e continuò il suo cammino. La mattina seguente, i paesani trovarono La Befana addormentata accanto al fuoco nella piazza del paese, con la scopa miracolosamente riparata. Il ragazzo, che aveva ricevuto la sciarpa, raccontò a tutti della sua gentilezza. Da quel giorno, i regali di La Befana furono ancora più preziosi, poiché erano dati con un cuore pieno d'amore.

story.en: In the ancient town of Taranto, there was a man named Giovanni who was cursed by a vengeful witch to transform into a giant spider each night. The curse was placed upon him because of his greed and unkindness. Every night, Giovanni would roam the village as the fearsome Taranto, spreading fear and despair. The villagers, terrified, sought help from a wise woman who lived in the hills. She told them that the only way to break the curse was for Giovanni to perform an act of true kindness. One night, as the Taranto, Giovanni saved a child from a burning building. His selfless act broke the curse, and he was transformed back into a human. From that day forward, Giovanni dedicated his life to helping others, and the town of Taranto was at peace once more.
story.it: Nell'antica città di Taranto, c'era un uomo di nome Giovanni che fu maledetto da una strega vendicativa a trasformarsi in un ragno gigante ogni notte. La maledizione gli fu inflitta a causa della sua avidità e cattiveria. Ogni notte, Giovanni vagava per il villaggio come il temuto Taranto, spargendo paura e disperazione. I paesani, terrorizzati, cercarono aiuto da una donna saggia che viveva sulle colline. Lei disse loro che l'unico modo per spezzare la maledizione era che Giovanni compisse un atto di vera gentilezza. Una notte, come Taranto, Giovanni salvò un bambino da un edificio in fiamme. Il suo atto disinteressato spezzò la maledizione e fu trasformato di nuovo in un uomo. Da quel giorno, Giovanni dedicò la sua vita ad aiutare gli altri e la città di Taranto tornò in pace.

title: The Guardian of the Olive Trees

story.en: In a lush olive grove in southern Italy, there was a sacred olive tree guarded by a fairy named Oliva. The villagers respected the tree, knowing that it brought them good harvests. One day, a greedy merchant named Marco tried to cut down the tree to sell the wood. As he struck the first blow, Oliva appeared, warning him to stop. Ignoring her, Marco continued, but each time he struck the tree, his axe shattered. Realizing the tree was protected, Marco begged for forgiveness. Oliva told him that he could atone for his greed by planting and caring for ten new olive trees. Marco did as he was told, and the grove flourished, bringing prosperity to the village.
story.it: In un rigoglioso uliveto nel sud Italia, c'era un albero di ulivo sacro custodito da una fata di nome Oliva. I paesani rispettavano l'albero, sapendo che portava loro buoni raccolti. Un giorno, un mercante avido di nome Marco tentò di abbattere l'albero per vendere il legno. Mentre dava il primo colpo, Oliva apparve, avvertendolo di fermarsi. Ignorandola, Marco continuò, ma ogni volta che colpiva l'albero, la sua ascia si frantumava. Rendendosi conto che l'albero era protetto, Marco implorò perdono. Oliva gli disse che poteva espiare la sua avidità piantando e curando dieci nuovi ulivi. Marco fece come gli fu detto e l'uliveto prosperò, portando prosperità al villaggio.

title: The Fisherman and the Golden Fish

story.en: In a coastal village of Sicily, there lived a poor fisherman named Pietro. One day, he caught a golden fish that spoke to him, begging to be released in exchange for a wish. Pietro, with a kind heart, set the fish free without asking for anything. When he returned home, he found his humble cottage transformed into a beautiful home, and his nets filled with fish. The golden fish had granted him prosperity for his selflessness. From then on, Pietro shared his fortune with the villagers, never forgetting the kindness of the golden fish.
story.it: In un villaggio costiero della Sicilia, viveva un povero pescatore di nome Pietro. Un giorno, catturò un pesce d'oro che gli parlò, implorandolo di essere liberato in cambio di un desiderio. Pietro, con un cuore gentile, liberò il pesce senza chiedere nulla. Quando tornò a casa, trovò la sua umile casetta trasformata in una splendida dimora e le sue reti piene di pesci. Il pesce d'oro gli aveva concesso prosperità per la sua generosità. Da quel giorno, Pietro condivise la sua fortuna con i paesani, senza mai dimenticare la gentilezza del pesce d'oro.

title: The Witch of the Seven Hills

story.en: In the heart of Rome, atop the Seven Hills, there lived a powerful witch named Belladonna. She was known for her beauty and her ability to control the winds. Many feared her, but she was also sought after for her wisdom. One day, a young man named Lorenzo came to her, asking for help to win the love of a girl from his village. Belladonna agreed, but on one condition: he must bring her a flower that only bloomed on the night of a full moon on the highest hill. Lorenzo, determined, climbed the hill and found the flower. When he returned, Belladonna smiled and told him that true love cannot be forced. She gave him a potion, not to make the girl love him, but to give him the courage to confess his feelings. The girl, touched by his sincerity, fell in love with him, and they lived happily ever after.
story.it: Nel cuore di Roma, in cima ai Sette Colli, viveva una potente strega di nome Belladonna. Era conosciuta per la sua bellezza e la sua capacità di controllare i venti. Molti la temevano, ma era anche ricercata per la sua saggezza. Un giorno, un giovane di nome Lorenzo venne da lei chiedendo aiuto per conquistare l'amore di una ragazza del suo villaggio. Belladonna acconsentì, ma a una condizione: doveva portarle un fiore che sbocciava solo nella notte di luna piena sulla collina più alta. Lorenzo, determinato, scalò la collina e trovò il fiore. Quando tornò, Belladonna sorrise e gli disse che il vero amore non può essere forzato. Gli diede una pozione, non per far innamorare la ragazza, ma per dargli il coraggio di confessare i suoi sentimenti. La ragazza, toccata dalla sua sincerità, si innamorò di lui e vissero felici per sempre.

title: The Lantern of the Lost Souls

story.en: In the shadowy woods of northern Italy, a mysterious lantern was said to guide lost souls to their final resting place. The lantern was kept by an old hermit named Matteo, who lived alone in a small hut. One evening, a group of travelers, lost in the dense forest, stumbled upon Matteo’s hut. Matteo welcomed them and told them about the lantern's power. As night fell, the travelers followed the lantern’s glow, which led them safely out of the forest. They discovered that the lantern was not just a guide but a symbol of Matteo's wisdom and compassion. They returned to their homes with a newfound appreciation for the old hermit and the magic of the lantern.
story.it: Nelle ombrose foreste del nord Italia, si diceva che una lanterna misteriosa guidasse le anime perse verso il loro ultimo riposo. La lanterna era custodita da un vecchio eremita di nome Matteo, che viveva solo in una piccola capanna. Una sera, un gruppo di viaggiatori, persi nella fitta foresta, si imbatté nella capanna di Matteo. Matteo li accolse e raccontò loro del potere della lanterna. Quando calò la notte, i viaggiatori seguirono il chiarore della lanterna, che li guidò in sicurezza fuori dalla foresta. Scoprirono che la lanterna non era solo una guida, ma un simbolo della saggezza e della compassione di Matteo. Tornarono a casa con una nuova apprezzamento per il vecchio eremita e la magia della lanterna.

story.en: In the hills of Tuscany, there was a vineyard owned by an old man named Francesco. One year, the vineyard faced a terrible drought, and the grapes began to wither. Francesco prayed to the ancient spirits of the land for help. That night, a mysterious figure appeared and told Francesco that the vineyard could only be saved by a song sung from the heart. Francesco, though unsure, sang a heartfelt melody under the moonlight. Miraculously, the next morning, the vines were lush and full of grapes. The villagers were amazed and celebrated Francesco's vineyard. They believed that the spirits had been moved by Francesco's genuine love for his land.
story.it: Sulle colline della Toscana, c'era un vigneto di proprietà di un uomo anziano di nome Francesco. Un anno, il vigneto affrontò una terribile siccità e le uve cominciarono ad appassire. Francesco pregò gli antichi spiriti della terra per aiuto. Quella notte, apparve una figura misteriosa e disse a Francesco che il vigneto poteva essere salvato solo da una canzone cantata dal cuore. Francesco, sebbene incerto, cantò una melodia sincera sotto la luce della luna. Miracolosamente, la mattina successiva, i vigneti erano rigogliosi e pieni di uva. I paesani erano stupiti e celebrarono il vigneto di Francesco. Credevano che gli spiriti fossero stati commossi dall'amore sincero di Francesco per la sua terra.

story.en: In the medieval city of Florence, a beautiful crown, the symbol of the city’s power, was stolen from the palace. The thief left behind a riddle that led to a secret location. The city’s bravest knight, Giovanni, took on the challenge. Following the riddle, Giovanni ventured through dark forests and across treacherous mountains. At the final location, he discovered that the crown had been stolen by a jealous rival who wanted to diminish Florence’s glory. Giovanni outwitted the rival with his cunning and bravery, retrieving the crown. The city celebrated his return and honored him with a grand feast. Giovanni's deeds became a legend, symbolizing the triumph of courage and intelligence.
story.it: Nella città medievale di Firenze, una bellissima corona, simbolo del potere della città, fu rubata dal palazzo. Il ladro lasciò dietro di sé un enigma che conduceva a un luogo segreto. Il cavaliere più coraggioso della città, Giovanni, accettò la sfida. Seguendo l'enigma, Giovanni si avventurò attraverso foreste oscure e montagne pericolose. Al luogo finale, scoprì che la corona era stata rubata da un rivale geloso che voleva diminuire la gloria di Firenze. Giovanni superò il rivale con astuzia e coraggio, recuperando la corona. La città celebrò il suo ritorno e lo onorò con un grande banchetto. Le imprese di Giovanni divennero una leggenda, simboleggiando il trionfo del coraggio e dell'intelligenza.

story.en: In a small village in the Apennine Mountains, an old map was discovered in an ancient chest. The map was said to lead to a hidden treasure buried by a pirate centuries ago. A group of villagers, led by the brave Isabella, decided to follow the map. Their journey took them through dangerous paths and mysterious caves. Along the way, they encountered various challenges that tested their resolve. Finally, they reached the treasure, which was not gold or jewels but a chest filled with old manuscripts and artifacts that revealed the rich history of their ancestors. The villagers were overjoyed to uncover their heritage and celebrated the discovery as a treasure more valuable than gold.
story.it: In un piccolo villaggio nei Monti Appennini, fu scoperta una vecchia mappa in un antico scrigno. Si diceva che la mappa conducesse a un tesoro nascosto sepolto da un pirata secoli fa. Un gruppo di paesani, guidato dalla coraggiosa Isabella, decise di seguire la mappa. Il loro viaggio li portò attraverso sentieri pericolosi e grotte misteriose. Lungo il cammino, affrontarono varie sfide che misero alla prova la loro determinazione. Infine, raggiunsero il tesoro, che non era oro o gioielli, ma uno scrigno pieno di manoscritti antichi e manufatti che rivelavano la ricca storia dei loro antenati. I paesani furono entusiasti di scoprire il loro patrimonio e celebrarono la scoperta come un tesoro più prezioso dell'oro.
